meanings.definition: A person who has power or authority over others.
meanings.sent1: The loord of the kingdom made important decisions.
meanings.sent2: The loord was respected by all the villagers.
meanings.sent3: The loord's cat thought it was the ruler of the house.
meanings.sent4: The loord of the jungle, the lion, roared fiercely.
meanings.sent5: The loord's crown shone brightly in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: To exercise power or authority over others.
meanings.sent1: He likes to loord over his siblings during playtime.
meanings.sent2: She tends to loord over her classmates in group projects.
meanings.sent3: The little boy tried to loord over his toys, pretending they were his subjects.
meanings.sent4: The storm loorded over the small town, causing chaos and destruction.
meanings.sent5: The bully tried to loord over the other kids on the playground.

meanings.definition: A title of respect or honor for a male ruler or nobleman.
meanings.sent1: The loord was greeted with cheers and applause.
meanings.sent2: In the story, the brave knight was known as the loord of the castle.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel declared himself the loord of the nut stash.
meanings.sent4: The wise old owl was considered the loord of the forest by all animals.
meanings.sent5: The loord's portrait hung proudly in the grand hall of the palace.
